page.title: 19RECREATION..GOLF
page.content: Ladybank Golf Course features in the southern part of this area. It lies on poor quality land, glacial outwash sands and gravels. The club was founded in 1879 with a membership of 26. In 1910 the course was extended from 6 holes to 9 holes and up to the full 18 holes in 1961. it is now one of the 3 qualifying courses in N.E.Fife for the British Open when the cometition is held at St.Andrews There are 880 members at Ladybank Golf Course_ 680 men, 100 women and 100 juveniles. Most members are local but a few come as far as from Glasgow. Members pay a yearly subscription viz: male/female senior: Â£70; male/female intermediate: Â£35; male/female juvenile: Â£18. New members pay an initial fee of Â£170 Waiting list..as long as 3 years!
